description.narrative:
The aim of the project is to construct a high security state-level prison with a capacity for 300 sentenced prisoners and 50 persons in pre-trial detention, according to the standards of the European Prison Rules and laws of BiH. Persons convicted by the State Court are presently held in outdated and overcrowded sub-standard Entity prisons in Foca and Zenica. These institutions are not suited to securely incarcerate and rehabilitate persons who have been convicted for crimes against humanity, genocide and organised crime. The risk of escape from the entity prisons is evident and damages the public’s confidence in the Bosnian justice system. There are over 150 persons in the Entities’ prisons serving their sentences imposed by the verdicts of the State Court. The majority are persons sentenced by the verdicts of war crimes or organized crime. Many of the detainees are placed in the Entities’ detention units (prisons), sometime quite far away from the State Court (Banja Luka, Mostar, Prijedor). They need to be brought in and out for the trials by the court police on daily basis which impacts the financial and security aspects of the trials.
Non-existence of a state-level facility is therefore a problem in terms of security and cost-efficiency as well as impact on the budget of the Ministry of Justice of BiH. The objective of this project is to solve some of these issues by building a high security state-level prison in Sarajevo. BiH's reputation of being unable to deal with growing organised crime obviously also affects its international reputation, hampering international investments and tourism. A high security state prison would however help to rebuilding the public’s confidence in the Bosnian justice system. The construction of a state prison also contains a rights dimension, since such a facility will introduce international human rights standards in the BiH prison system this would be a step towards European integration.

Syftet med projektet är att etablera ett satligt säkerhetsfängelse med kapactiet i enlighet med europeisk fängelsestandard och national lag. Fänlelst kommer att inhysa 300 dömda fångar och 50 häktade dömda rspektive åtalade för krigsförbrytelser, korruption och organiserad brottslighet. Den svenska finansieringen kanaliserars genom Euuroparådets utveklingsbank (CEB).

The aim of the project is to construct a prison and establish a high security institution complianat with the standards of the European Prison Rules and laws of BiH. The prison will host 300 convicts and 50 detainees, sentenced and indicted for serious war crimes, organised crime and corruption. Teh Swedish funds will be executed through a co-financing through the CEB (Concil of Europe Dev Bank)

description.narrative: The Completion report is made after receipt of the the final report from the Council of Europe Development Bank (CEB) which was sent July 9th 2019. The report details all activities and transactions that also relate to Sida portion of funding to the State Prison project. The PIU is expressing satisfaction to note that the project was completed under budget. All Sida funds have been disbursed and small account balance remains (less than 200euro) which should remain with the State budget as the cost of repayment are likely more than the actual sum. Since all construction phases have ended including the defects notification period, the CEB indicates that it will no longer monitor the project and considers it closed. A building maintenance plan is the final output that was delivered to the client, Ministry of Justice BiH, and it is up to the ministry now to staff and put in operation the prison in full. The ministry needs the Council of Ministers to approve the appointment of prison director and at the time of the report is still waiting for such approval-a political decision.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
